basics.name: Brad Greenlee
basics.label: Independent Software Developer
basics.summary: Veteran technologist and software architect with 30+ years designing high-scale systems that solve complex problems. Expert in cloud infrastructure, full-stack development, and building innovative tools across mobile, web, and desktop. Equally effective leading engineering teams and delivering hands-on solutions in fast-paced environments from early startups to established enterprises. tl;dr: I love hard problems and shipping.

work.name: Fiasco Partners
highlights: Helped a $3B global systems integrator develop a strategy getting themselves out of a data quagmire, and lead development of their new data stack until they were able to staff the project.
Building Primary Every Democrat (https://primary.every.democrat), in an effort to pressure our Democratic leaders to step up.

work.name: Greenlee LLC
highlights: Wikimedia Foundation - Developed data modeling guidelines for WMF's Hive/Iceberg data lake and recommended improvements to their metrics/experimentation event architecture
East Bay Kidical Mass - Built a site for managing give-aways of free bikes for kids.

work.name: Etsy
work.summary: Over 11 years working with a broad range of teams, primarily in Data Engineering.
highlights: Advisor to teams across Data Engineering, including Data Platform, Data Governance and Privacy, Data Quality, and GCS Costs
Designed and built proof-of-concept of a point-in-time database using Change Data Capture (CDC), Kafka, and BigQuery
Helped build and maintain a clickstream event system, processing over 10 billion events/day, and having only 45 minutes of downtime in 9 years (99.999% uptime)
Designed and developed a gRPC-based messaging system that allowed teams across Engineering to deliver messages to Kafka and BigQuery from any client platform
Helped migrate our Kafka-based streaming infrastructure from on-prem to Google Cloud, and then to Kubernetes
Designed and implemented a "layering" system for experiments that allowed for global experiment holdout groups, which were essential for assessing the impact and interplay of experiments as we grew
Developed systems for identifying and filtering bot traffic
Designed and developed an enterprise search system that was used across the company
Built a system for controlling 80+ displays in our offices
Built a number of seller tools, including pricing, coupons, and shop suggestions
Post-mortem facilitator
Mentored many engineers, from interns to Staff-level
Taught Etsy School classes in Mac application development and outdoor rock climbing

work.name: Twistle, Inc
highlights: Established core infrastructure, including configuration management and deployment with Chef and Fabric, Git and GitHub for version control, and Backbone.js on the frontend
Did frontend development in Javascript, backend in Python/Django

work.name: Daylife
highlights: Designed a Mechanical Turk-based system for evaluating content extraction methods, allowing Daylife to significantly improve data quality
Evaluated content categorization tools and implemented a system to automatically categorize thousands of feeds
Designed and developed a web analytics pipeline on top of HBase

work.name: McKinsey & Company
highlights: Wrote a Rails-based content management application
Used Solr/Tika to allow searching of Word, Excel, and Powerpoint documents

work.name: Infectious.com
highlights: Developed and maintained a Rails-based e-commerce site

work.name: Wesabe
work.summary: First engineer for one of the top personal finance management tools and communities
highlights: Involved in the architecture and/or development of most of the site
Implemented the concept of a "privacy wall" to separate users' identities from their data
Led the implementation of white-label and web services products for financial institutions

work.name: Triporama
work.summary: Primary architect and developer for a unique travel startup offering tools and resources for group travel planning
highlights: Led the re-architecting and redesign of the application and website following a major shift in company focus
Development was done in Java, using Tapestry, Hibernate, Spring, and Tomcat
Helped with transitioning the site to Ruby on Rails

work.name: McKinsey & Co.
work.summary: Lead developer for a Perl-based intranet site
highlights: Responsibilities included software design and development, database design and development, system architecture, and system administration

work.name: iSyndicate
work.summary: Joined as the eighth employee and first full-time engineer, helping iSyndicate become a pioneer in Internet-syndicated content and Internet syndication infrastructure
highlights: Developed many of their initial internal systems and end-user applications
Moved from Engineering to Product Management in March 2000
Responsible for conceiving, designing, developing, and project managing numerous products, both internal and customer-facing, using Java, Perl, XML, and relational databases
Research and evaluation of standards and vendor technologies
Input into overall product and engineering infrastructure strategies
Technical resource for partner and critical customer discussions

work.name: Noblestar Systems
work.summary: Technical lead on a number of Java projects
highlights: Developed a Java version of Allaire's Cold Fusion application server
Created a Java client-server database access tool using JDBC, RMI, and CORBA
Built a Web/Java-based course catalog and registration application, integrated into an existing PeopleSoft system
Spearheaded the establishment of a West Coast presence for the Emerging Technologies Division

work.name: iSYS Hungary
work.summary: Co-founded iSYS Hungary, Hungary's first business-focused Internet Service Provider and a leading web design and consulting firm
highlights: Performed a critical role in nearly every aspect of the company's development, including business planning, technical management, recruiting, and financial controlling
Primary focus was on software development, most notably Intranet application design and development

work.name: American Management Systems
work.summary: Participated in two large programming projects
highlights: Designed and developed Object-Oriented applications, using C++ and Smalltalk, in a Windows environment
Provided technical support for clients

projects.name: I Can't Even
projects.description: Safari Extension (Mac & iOS) that lets you redact or hide content on web pages.

projects.name: Primary Every Democrat!
projects.description: Site allowing visitors to sign up to be notified of upcoming Democratic primary elections and submit "receipts" calling out objectionable or laudable behavior by their congresspeople.

projects.name: Spelling Beat
projects.description: A little serverless app to find solutions for the NYT's Spelling Bee game.

projects.name: Sunrise in Your Menu Bar
projects.description: Mac menu bar app that displays sunrise & sunset info for your (or any) location.

projects.name: Wanderings
projects.description: iOS app and accompanying website that tracks your location in the background and gives you a heatmap of your travels.

projects.name: QR Life
projects.description: iOS app that turns QR codes into Game of Life simulations.

projects.name: remotes.club
projects.description: A home for remote workers. https://remotes.club

projects.name: pygtail
projects.description: Pygtail reads log file lines that have not been read. It will even handle log files that have been rotated. Based on logcheck's logtail2

projects.name: The License Plate Game
projects.description: A web game where the challenge is to find as many words as possible containing the letters in the given license plate (in order!).

projects.name: WallpaperInfo
projects.description: A little Mac menu bar app to display the current aerial wallpaper description.

projects.name: sublime-github
projects.description: Github Gist plugin for Sublime Text 2/3

projects.name: WeatherBar
projects.description: A walk-through creating an OS X menu bar app in Swift.

projects.name: JobTracker
projects.description: A Mac menu bar app interface to the Hadoop JobTracker. It gives you easy access to jobs in JobTracker, and provides Growl/Notification Center notices of starting, completed, and failed jobs.

projects.name: Squeeler
projects.description: A Mac OS X app that sits quietly in your menu bar and alerts you when it sees something hogging CPU.

projects.name: PassKeeper
projects.description: An ancient Windows utility that allows you to keep an encrypted list of accounts with usernames, passwords, and notes. Possibly the first commercial password manager.
